Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

Section.name: S_6560
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note E)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_35973
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_35973_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327653
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6563
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_37804
ListItem.title: pTis: High-grade dysplasia / carcinoma in situ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_55954
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the lamina propria or submucosa

ListItem.name: LI_6565
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor invades the lamina propria

ListItem.name: LI_6566
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37810
DisplayedItem.title: # For T3 tumors, the nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue is, for the jejunum and ileum, part of the mesentery and, for the duodenum in areas where serosa is lacking, part of the interface with the pancreas.

ListItem.name: LI_37808
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa, or extends into nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue (mesentery or retroperitoneum) without serosal penetration#

ListItem.name: LI_37809
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor perforates the visceral peritoneum or directly invades other organs or structures (e.g., other loops of small intestine, mesentery of adjacent loops of bowel, and abdominal wall by way of serosa; for duodenum only, invasion of pancreas or bile duct)

ListItem.name: LI_327655
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327656
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6571
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_37815
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_37816
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in three or more regional lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_20248
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_20248_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52166
DisplayedItem.title: For reporting molecular testing and immunohistochemistry for mismatch repair proteins, and for other cancer biomarker testing results, the CAP Colorectal Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
